name: Spanish Farro
author: Chef John
summary: I learned how to make Spanish rice at a Mexican restaurant where I worked part-time years ago. Here, we're substituting the 'ancient' grain of farro for the rice, and I think it's even easier to cook perfectly than rice.
ingredients: 1 ½ teaspoons kosher salt, or to taste
1 cup pearled farro, rinsed, drained well
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Melt butter in a heavy skillet with a tight-fitting lid over medium heat
Add onions and salt; cook and stir until onions have softened up and turned translucent, about 5 minutes
Add cumin, ancho chili powder, and chipotle chili powder; cook and stir about 1 minute
Add tomato paste; cook and stir about 2 minutes over medium heat
Stir until farro is completely coated with the spice/butter mixture, about 2 minutes
Raise heat to high and bring to a simmer
As soon as mixture starts to bubble, stir, and cover
Place pan in preheated oven and bake until farro is tender, 50 to 60 minutes
